Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tenuous \Ten"u*ous\, a. [L. tenuis thin. See {Thin}, and cf. {Tenuis}.] 1. Thin; slender; small; minute. [1913 Webster]
2. Rare; subtile; not dense; -- said of fluids. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]

tenuous adj 1: having little substance or significance; "a flimsy excuse"; "slight evidence"; "a tenuous argument"; "a thin plot" [syn: {flimsy}, {slight}, {thin}] 2: having thin consistency; "a tenuous fluid" 3: very thin in gauge or diameter; "a tenuous thread"
